modules.description: This module defines the `t` type representing hinting modes for font rendering. It includes constants for common hinting levels: `Normal`, `Light`, `Mono`, and `None`. These values are used to control how glyphs are adjusted for screen display when loading fonts with specific rendering preferences.

This module defines bitwise style flags for text rendering with SDL2_ttf, supporting operations to combine, subtract, and test style attributes. It works with the abstract type `t` representing font styles such as bold, italic, underline, and strikethrough. Use it to configure and manipulate text appearance in graphical applications, such as setting bold and italic styles for UI elements or checking if a style includes underline.

This module provides glyph metrics for font rendering, including bounding box dimensions and advance width. It works with font glyphs to determine spatial layout and rendering characteristics. Concrete use cases include calculating text width, aligning rendered text, and determining line spacing in graphical applications.

This module provides font configuration, text measurement, and glyph rendering capabilities for graphical applications. It operates on font objects to manipulate styling (bold, italic), hinting, and kerning parameters, while producing SDL surfaces through text rendering operations that support UTF-8 encoding, word wrapping, and color blending. Key use cases include dynamic text layout in games, internationalized text display, and runtime font property adjustments for UI elements.

This module handles font configuration, text measurement, and glyph rendering for graphical applications. It works with font objects to control styling, hinting, and kerning, and generates SDL surfaces for text with support for UTF-8, word wrapping, and color blending. It is used for dynamic text layout in games, internationalized text display, and adjusting font properties at runtime for UI elements.
